item.title: Rift Between Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar? BCCI Breaks Silence On Rumours - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rift Between Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar? BCCI Breaks Silence On Rumours

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

The BCCI has confirmed the announcement date for the ICC Champions Trophy squad while dismissing rumors of rifts among key cricket figures amidst their recent performance issues.

  • The squad for the ICC Champions Trophy will be announced on February 18 or 19.
  • India will compete in the tournament hosted by Pakistan and UAE from February 19 to March 9.
  • Key matches include a face-off against Pakistan on February 23.
  • BCCI's Rajeev Shukla refuted claims of discord between Ajit Agarkar, Gautam Gambhir, and Rohit Sharma.
  • Recent poor performances by Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were acknowledged as part of the sport's ebbs and flows.
  • The Kho Kho World Cup has also started in New Delhi, featuring multiple countries.
“Completely wrong statement to be made. No rift between coach, selection chairman, coach and captain.” - Rajeev Shukla

The BCCI's efforts to clarify rumors are crucial as they prepare for an important cricketing season that places them under significant scrutiny.

item.title: 'Kapil Dev bhi janta hai woh crack hai': Former Indian cricketer reacts to Yograj Singh's 'bullet' statem - The Times of India
item.description:
'Kapil Dev bhi janta hai woh crack hai': Former Indian cricketer reacts to Yograj Singh's 'bullet' statement

Publication Date: Date not specified in the article
Source: Not specified

The article discusses the reaction of former Indian cricketer Kapil Dev to a statement made by Yograj Singh, which was referred to as his 'bullet' statement.

  • Kapil Dev acknowledges the controversy surrounding Yograj Singh's remarks.
  • The reaction emphasizes the ongoing dynamics within Indian cricket.
  • The article may include comments from other notable figures in cricket.
“Kapil Dev bhi janta hai woh crack hai,” reflecting the sentiments expressed in the cricket community.

The discussion brings to light the complexities and sometimes contentious nature of remarks made by former players in the public eye.

item.title: 'I'll bowl at 150-160 km/h and show them': Pakistan pacer 'boycotts and retires' from PSL after draft pick snub - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pakistan Pacer Ihsanullah Retires from PSL After Draft Snub

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

After being overlooked in the PSL 10 draft, Ihsanullah announces a permanent boycott of the tournament and vows to focus on domestic cricket, aiming to prove his bowling capabilities at speeds of 150-160 km/h.

  • Ihsanullah found no takers during the PSL 10 draft, leading to his retirement from the league.
  • He emphasized that his decision was calculated rather than an emotional reaction.
  • The fast bowler plans to showcase his skills in domestic matches to make a comeback.
  • His former team's owner expressed concern about his ability to return to high speeds following an elbow injury.
“I just don’t want to play franchise cricket anymore. It’s over after today. I completely boycott it and retire from the PSL.”

This move marks a significant shift in Ihsanullah's career as he aims to reclaim his position as a top bowler in Pakistan cricket.

item.title: Virat Kohli should take a leaf out of Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket: DDCA secretary - The Indian Express
item.description:
Virat Kohli should take a leaf out of Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket: DDCA secretary

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

DDCA secretary Ashok Sharma has urged Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant to participate in the Ranji Trophy. He points out a gap in the culture of participation in domestic cricket compared to Mumbai.

  • Kohli and Pant are named in the probable squad for the last rounds of the Ranji Trophy.
  • Sharma emphasizes the importance of playing for one's state team when available.
  • There are concerns regarding player fitness and participation influenced by busy schedules.
  • DDCA president Rohan Jaitley supports participation in domestic cricket for all players.
  • Kohli last played for Delhi in the Ranji Trophy in 2012.
  • Jaitley mentions that Kohli's presence could greatly impact younger players in Delhi.
“It is exceptionally important to participate in the domestic tournament. If on national duty, obviously one cannot participate, but otherwise, they should.” - Rohan Jaitley

In conclusion, engaging in domestic cricket is vital for players like Kohli and Pant, not just for performance but also for contributing to the development of future talent in the sport.

item.title: I stood on the balcony and thought 'What just happened?': Kaun Nair, ignored by India after 303, hits doubters for a six - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in the Vijay Hazare Trophy

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karun Nair's recent performances in the Vijay Hazare Trophy have been stellar, leading Vidarbha to the semi-finals. He reflects on his career struggles and emotional highs while expressing gratitude for the opportunities he has received.

  • Nair has scored multiple centuries, including five hundreds in the ongoing tournament.
  • He shared his emotional journey and hardships, emphasizing the importance of each innings.
  • Nair attributes his success this season to learning from past disappointments.
  • He hopes to make a return to the Indian national team, cherishing his past achievements, including a triple century.
Nair: "I think it was an emotional moment. It was just probably in the heat of the moment kind of post. I am usually pretty calm and composed most of the time."

Karun Nair’s resilience and outstanding form this season demonstrate his commitment and the potential for further greatness in cricket.

item.title: Rohit Sharma joins Mumbai Ranji Trophy squad for training at Wankhede - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Joins Mumbai Ranji Trophy Squad for Training at Wankhede

Date: October 22, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has officially joined the Mumbai Ranji Trophy squad as they prepare for their upcoming matches at the Wankhede Stadium.

  • Rohit aims to regain his form ahead of the domestic tournament.
  • The training sessions will focus on team synergy and fitness levels.
  • Sharma's leadership is expected to inspire younger players in the squad.
“I am excited to work with the young talent in the team and hope to lead us to success in the Ranji Trophy.” – Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, Rohit Sharma’s participation in Mumbai's training sessions is a significant boost for the team as they gear up for the Ranji Trophy, aiming to reclaim their status as champions.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's viral video with Sachin Tendulkar makes badminton star PV Sindhu EMOTIONAL, her statement goes viral - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's viral video with Sachin Tendulkar makes badminton star PV Sindhu EMOTIONAL, her statement goes viral

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: India.com

Indian badminton star PV Sindhu reacted emotionally to a viral video featuring Vinod Kambli and Sachin Tendulkar, sharing her thoughts on the importance of careful investment.

  • PV Sindhu expressed that one must invest wisely, especially after seeing Vinod Kambli's condition.
  • Kambli is currently surviving on a BCCI pension of Rs 30,000 per month.
  • Sindhu recently got married to Venkata Sai Datta.
  • She stated that her husband manages her investments, and she hasn’t faced any financial struggles.
“You have to invest carefully... If you don't, you are in trouble,” - PV Sindhu

This incident highlights the significant financial challenges faced by former athletes and serves as a cautionary tale for others.

item.title: King, Garth dismantle England as Australia extend Ashes lead in low-scoring win - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Australia Defeats England in Low-Scoring Ashes ODI Thriller

Publication Date: [Include publication date] Source: [Include source]

Australia triumphed over England by 21 runs in a thrilling match at the Junction Oval, managing to defend a low total of 180 runs.

  • Australia scored 180 runs, with Ellyse Perry contributing a significant 60 runs.
  • England collapsed to 159 runs, with Alana King taking 4 wickets for 25 runs and Kim Garth taking 3 for 37.
  • This match marked the lowest total ever defended in an Ashes ODI.
  • England's batting was marred by poor decision-making and execution, leading to their downfall.
  • Key moments included Amy Jones getting stranded on 47 runs as her team lost 8 wickets for 49 runs.
  • The match highlighted the pressure on England in the ongoing multi-format series.
“Having the Shane Warne stand now, yeah, it was pretty surreal to be quite honest, but more happy to get the win.” - Alana King

This victory gives Australia a four-point lead in the Ashes series, showcasing their resilience in the face of collapsing innings.

item.title: Landmark launch in Kuala Lumpur as captains ready for ICC U19 Women’s T20 World Cup 2025 - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Landmark launch in Kuala Lumpur as captains ready for ICC U19 Women’s T20 World Cup 2025

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

The captains of the 16 participating teams gathered in Kuala Lumpur for the launch of the ICC U19 Women’s T20 World Cup 2025, marking a significant moment before the teams disperse for the group stages.

  • The tournament begins on 18 January, with teams split across Malaysia.
  • Malaysian captain Nur Dania Syuhada expressed pride in representing her country at this prestigious event.
  • Team locations include Sarawak for Group C and Johor for Group B, while Group A remains near Kuala Lumpur.
“Participating in a World Cup trophy photo shoot along with 15 countries' captains provided me with an extraordinary experience.” - Nur Dania Syuhada

This event not only highlights the talent of young cricketers but also serves as a platform for cultural exchange and the growth of women's cricket in Malaysia.

item.title: Sania Mirza divorce from Shoaib Malik: What India star got from Pakistan cricketer after separation - India.com
item.description:
Sania Mirza's Divorce from Shoaib Malik: Key Outcomes and Financial Arrangements

Publication Date: 2024 - Source: India.com

Sania Mirza and Shoaib Malik have divorced in 2024, leading to various discussions regarding the financial outcomes of their separation.

  • Sania Mirza received a 'Haq Mehr' of Rs 61 lakh from Shoaib Malik as part of the divorce settlement.
  • Mirza has a reported net worth of Rs 216 crore, which raised questions about the financial dynamics of their marriage.
  • Shoaib Malik was previously married to Ayesha Siddiqui and is reported to have paid her Rs 15 crore after their divorce.
  • The couple shares a son named Izhaan Mirza Malik, born in 2018.
  • Mirza sought a 'khula', a form of Islamic divorce, indicating an active choice in the separation process.
"Sania Mirza took 'khula' from husband Shoaib Malik, which means she sought a divorce from him without any financial gain."

The divorce has garnered significant media attention due to the high profiles of both individuals and the implications of their financial arrangements.

item.title: Nations who have announced their squads for ICC Champions Trophy 2025, why India and Pakistan are lagging behind? - India.com
item.description:
Nations Announce Squads for ICC Champions Trophy 2025: India and Pakistan Lagging Behind

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India.com

The ICC Champions Trophy will commence from February 19, hosted by Pakistan after an eight-year-long pause since the last edition in 2017. Pakistan, as the defending champion, will feel the home advantage, while India will play their matches in the UAE under the hybrid model.

  • Defending champions Pakistan to clash with New Zealand in the opening match.
  • India and Pakistan match scheduled for February 23.
  • All teams except India and Pakistan have announced their squads.
“The national selection committee is likely to convene on January 19, following the Vijay Hazare Trophy final, to finalize the 15-member provisional squad for the Champions Trophy.”

With the anticipation building, there are questions regarding the strategies India and Pakistan will adopt as the tournament approaches.

item.title: Man Utd transfer news: Medical completed as Rashford nears exit and update issued on striker talks - The Mirror
item.description:
Man Utd transfer news: Medical completed as Rashford nears exit and update issued on striker talks

Date: 03:00, 14 Jan 2025
Source: Mirror

Manchester United are ramping up their business as the January transfer window nears its halfway stage. Marcus Rashford is reportedly closing in on a loan move to AC Milan, allowing United to pursue new striking options.

  • Marcus Rashford may join AC Milan on loan, potentially freeing space for new signings.
  • Young defender Diego Leon has completed a medical ahead of a pre-contract agreement.
  • United are also linked with PSG’s Nuno Mendes to strengthen their left-back position.
  • Alejandro Garnacho is attracting interest from Napoli, while Antony is being pursued by Real Betis and Olympiacos.
  • United are reportedly in talks for PSG striker Randal Kolo Muani.
“I don’t know. The transfer window, for me, is more like the market for fruit, fish, bread,” said PSG boss Luis Enrique.

This transfer window could shape Manchester United's future, with potential key moves affecting the squad's dynamics.

SA20 2025: Match 7, PC vs SEC Match Prediction

The Pretoria Capitals will face the Sunrisers Eastern Cape in the 7th match of the SA20 2025 tournament. Both teams are in search of their first win after poor starts to the season.

item.title: Rohit Sharma to turn up for Mumbai Ranji Trophy practice on Tuesday - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rohit Sharma to Attend Mumbai Ranji Trophy Practice Session

Date: January 13, 2025
Source: Indian Express

Rohit Sharma, the Indian cricket captain, will be joining the Mumbai Ranji Trophy team for a practice session aimed at preparing for upcoming matches.

  • Sharma will practice at Wankhede Stadium on Tuesday morning.
  • He has resumed training to prepare for the Champions Trophy.
  • The Mumbai team will engage in a center-wicket practice for the next Ranji Trophy league match against Jammu & Kashmir.
  • Sharma has not confirmed his availability for the match yet.
  • This will be his first appearance with the Mumbai team since 2015.
  • Indian team coach Gautam Gambhir emphasized the importance of playing domestic cricket.
“I would always like everyone to play domestic cricket. That is how much importance domestic cricket needs to be given.” - Gautam Gambhir

It remains uncertain if other star players like Virat Kohli will participate in the upcoming matches as BCCI encourages but does not mandate participation in domestic cricket.

item.title: Watch: India Star Climbs Tirupati Stairs On Knees After Return From BGT - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: India Star Climbs Tirupati Stairs On Knees After Return From BGT

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Nitish Reddy showcased his devotion by climbing the stairs of Tirupati temple on his knees following his performances in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • India lost the five-match series to Australia 1-3, failing to reach the World Test Championship final.
  • Nitish Reddy scored a century on his debut tour, making headlines with a knock of 114 in Melbourne.
  • Reddy received a hero's welcome upon returning to his hometown of Visakhapatnam.

Nitish Kumar Reddy climbing stairs of Tirupati after scoring ton in his debut series. The peace is in the feet of Govinda pic.twitter.com/23xKmNOpaC

— Pari (@BluntIndianGal) January 13, 2025

Nitish concluded the series as India's second-highest run-getter with 298 runs across five matches.

item.title: Viral Video: Nitish Kumar Reddy Climbs Tirupati Stairs On Knees After Return From Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Climbs Tirupati Stairs on Knees Following BGT Return

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

Nitish Reddy visited the Tirupati temple to express his devotion after an impressive debut series in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series 1-3 against Australia, missing out on the World Test Championship final.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy celebrated his century during the fourth Test, becoming a notable player despite the team's loss.
  • Reddy climbed the stairs of the Tirupati temple on his knees as a gesture of devotion, shared via an Instagram video.
  • He received a hero's welcome upon returning to Visakhapatnam, with fans showering petals and presenting him with a yellow garland.
  • In five matches, he scored 298 runs, including a maiden Test century of 114 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

Nitish Kumar Reddy climbing stairs of Tirupati after scoring ton in his debut series. The peace is in the feet of Govinda — Pari (@BluntIndianGal) January 13, 2025

This display of devotion and talent has endeared Nitish Reddy to fans, marking a memorable start to his cricketing career.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Blow To Gautam Gambhir, Setback For 'Wife' Anushka Sharma As BCCI Proposes Stricter Rules: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Proposes Stricter Rules Affecting Players' Families and Support Staff

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is considering implementing new rules that will restrict players’ families' presence during overseas tours, aiming to improve performance.

  • The proposed rules would limit players' families, particularly their wives, to a two-week stay during a 45-day tour.
  • Players would be required to travel in the team bus with their squad members.
  • Gautam Gambhir and his manager would face restrictions regarding accommodation and travel during tours.
  • The BCCI plans to charge players for luggage exceeding 150kg during air travel.
  • Meetings held among BCCI officials, including discussions on performance and support staff tenure.
“The BCCI feels that players’ performances on overseas tours get affected negatively if they stay with their families for long durations.”

In summary, the BCCI is tightening regulations to ensure a more focused environment for players, amidst concerns over performance deficiencies.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir's Wings Clipped, Setback For Players' Wives As BCCI Enforces New Rules: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Proposes New Rules Impacting Players' Families and Coach Gambhir

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

In response to India's disappointing Test campaign, the BCCI is set to implement strict rules regarding players' family stays during long tours, potentially affecting performance.

  • BCCI proposes limiting family stays to two weeks for 45-day tours.
  • Players required to travel with the team, discouraging solo travel.
  • Gautam Gambhir’s manager not allowed in team hotel or to join him in VIP sections.
  • Players must cover costs for luggage exceeding 150kg during air travel.
  • Meeting held with key figures, including Rohit Sharma and Ajit Agarkar, to discuss future strategies.
“Certain support staff members have been with the team for quite a long time; performances have plateaued.”

The new rules could significantly alter the dynamics of team life and performance, reflecting the BCCI's push for improvement.

item.title: "Shocker": BCCI Ecosystem Slammed As Batter, With 664 Average, Continues To Be Ignored - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI's Oversight: Karun Nair's Impressive Domestic Form Ignored

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Karun Nair, an out-of-favour Indian batter, has showcased exceptional performance in domestic cricket, scoring his fourth consecutive hundred in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Karun Nair scored an unbeaten 122 runs off 82 balls with 13 fours and 5 sixes.
  • He currently holds an average of 664 in the tournament, amassing 664 runs in 8 matches.
  • Nair is tied with several prominent players, including Kumar Sangakkara, for achieving four successive List A hundreds.
  • Despite his remarkable performance, Nair has struggled to regain his place in the Indian national team since scoring a triple century in 2016.
  • Former cricketer Robin Uthappa criticized the BCCI ecosystem for overlooking talented players like Nair.
"If you are not going to let him play, then why are you giving hope to him... It is a shocker because of our cricket ecosystem." - Robin Uthappa

The article highlights the troubling trend of talented players being overlooked by the BCCI, emphasizing the need for recognition of their achievements in domestic cricket.

item.title: ‘She was so happy’: Mumbai woman’s reaction on spotting Virat-Anushka is viral. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘She was so happy’: Mumbai woman’s reaction on spotting Virat-Anushka is viral. Watch

Date: Jan 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma stunned bystanders with a rare public appearance at the Gateway of India, generating excitement and a viral video featuring a young woman’s ecstatic reaction to spotting them.

  • The couple appeared casually dressed with minimal security.
  • A video captured a woman’s joyful realization as she recognized the celebrity couple.
  • Social media users found the woman's reaction heartwarming and entertaining.
  • The couple was praised for their low-key presence amidst the crowd.
“That girl in white dress behind Anushka is the story. Her reaction is so so cute,” an Instagram user commented.

This delightful incident showcases the charm of celebrity encounters, as well as the civility of bystanders who respected the couple’s space.

item.title: 'They will call it off': Kapil Dev on Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma retirement buzz - The Times of India
item.description:
They will call it off: Kapil Dev on Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma retirement buzz

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: Times of India

In a recent discussion, cricket legend Kapil Dev shared his thoughts on the ongoing retirement buzz surrounding star players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He emphasized that fans should not worry, as he believes they will continue to contribute significantly to the game.

  • Kapil Dev reassures fans about Kohli and Sharma's future in cricket.
  • He reflects on the importance of experience in the team dynamics.
  • Dev points out that speculation is common in cricket but should not distract from players' performance.
"They will call it off... there’s still a lot of cricket left for them to play." - Kapil Dev

Overall, Kapil Dev's comments provide a calming perspective amid the retirement speculations, encouraging fans to remain optimistic about the future of these pivotal players.

item.title: On table after Australia Test series loss: Performance-based variable pay - The Indian Express
item.description:
Performance-Based Pay for Indian Cricket Players Proposed After Australia Series Loss

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Indian cricket team management proposed a performance-based variable pay structure following their recent 1-3 Test series defeat against Australia. This system aims to enhance player accountability, mirroring corporate appraisal methods.

  • Discussion among team leadership, including captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir.
  • Proposed system impacts player earnings based on performance metrics.
  • Incentive system introduced in 2022-23 pays Rs 30 lakh per game for players in more than 50% of Tests.
  • Concerns raised regarding players' commitment to Test cricket versus white-ball formats.
  • The Indian team has struggled recently, with a previous series loss against New Zealand.
“There was discussion whether the current players were a bit indifferent when India loses a Test match.”

The introduction of a performance-based pay structure reflects a growing concern about player commitment to Test cricket. The management emphasizes the need for accountability to re-instill appreciation for this traditional format.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Over To Virat Kohli As Rohit Sharma Makes Big Ranji Trophy Call To Prolong Test Career - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Over To Virat Kohli As Rohit Sharma Makes Big Ranji Trophy Call To Prolong Test Career

Date: October 25, 2024 Source: NDTV

Rohit Sharma, India's Test captain, is returning to basics by joining Mumbai's Ranji Trophy team for practice. This move comes after India's disappointing tour in Australia.

  • Rohit Sharma is set to practice with Mumbai's Ranji Trophy team at Wankhede Stadium.
  • He is preparing for the Champions Trophy following a poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • While his selection for the upcoming match against Jammu & Kashmir is undecided, he aims to improve his technique in red-ball cricket.
  • Gautam Gambhir emphasized the significance of players returning to domestic cricket to enhance their Test game.
  • Virat Kohli is also encouraged to resume playing domestic matches to regain form.
“If you don’t give importance to domestic cricket, you will never get the desired players that you want in Test cricket.” - Gautam Gambhir

This decision signals a commitment to improving skills ahead of important tests and highlights the value of domestic cricket in nurturing top talent.

item.title: Women’s Ashes 2025 LIVE: Australia v England 2nd ODI - Sydney Morning Herald
item.description:
Women’s Ashes 2025 LIVE: Australia v England 2nd ODI

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Australia's performance in the second ODI against England has been challenging as they struggle with their batting and look to improve with the ball.

  • This marks Australia’s lowest score in an ODI on home soil since 2009.
  • Ash Gardner led the bowling attack with three wickets, while Kim Garth, Annabel Sutherland, and Alana King each claimed two wickets.
  • Heather Knight was the top scorer for England with 39 runs.
  • Australia needs to deliver a strong bowling performance to challenge England's openers, Maia Bouchier and Tammy Beaumont.
  • Alyssa Healy is expected to fuel energy in the field for her team.
“That is Australia’s lowest score posted in an ODI on home soil since 2009.”

Australia faces a notable challenge ahead but will aim to turn the tide in upcoming innings.

item.title: Sachin Ko Bolo ...": Yograj Singh On Why Arjun Tendulkar Stopped Training Under Him - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sachin Ko Bolo...: Yograj Singh Discusses Arjun Tendulkar's Coaching Journey

Publication Date: January 13, 2025
Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer and coach Yograj Singh shared insights on why Arjun Tendulkar ceased training under him after a short period, revealing the fears of reputational association in the competitive cricket landscape.

  • Yograj Singh coached Arjun Tendulkar for only 12 days in 2022.
  • During this period, Arjun made his First Class debut and scored a century.
  • He expressed concerns that associations with him might hurt Arjun's reputation.
  • Yograj suggested that Sachin Tendulkar should keep Arjun with him for a year for better development.
  • As of now, Arjun has played several matches across formats, including IPL with modest performance.
"When he scored a hundred on debut and then returned to IPL, then people were afraid, what if his (Arjun's) name gets stuck with me?" - Yograj Singh

Yograj Singh's candid remarks highlight the intricacies of mentorship and the pressures young athletes face in the world of professional sports.
